import log from './logger';
const REQUEST_TIMEOUT = 30000;
 
function isHttpSuccess(code) {
  return (code >= 200 && code < 300);
}
 
function isHttpReply(packet) {
  return packet && packet.header && packet.header.http_status;
}
 
export default class PacketInterface {
 
  constructor(socket) {
    Object.defineProperties(this, {
      _activeRequests: { value: new Map() },
      _socket: { value: socket }
    });
 
    this._socket.on('reply', this._processReply.bind(this));
    this._socket.on('disconnected', () => {
      this._activeRequests.forEach((descriptor) => {
        clearTimeout(descriptor.timeout);
        descriptor.reject(new Error('Twilsock disconnected'));
      });
      this._activeRequests.clear();
    });
  }
 
 
  _processReply(reply) {
    const request = this._activeRequests.get(reply.id);
    if (request) {
      clearTimeout(request.timeout);
      this._activeRequests.delete(reply.id);
 
      setTimeout(() => {
        // User shouldn't intercept connection handling, thus making it asynchronous
        if (!isHttpSuccess(reply.status.code)) {
          request.reject(new Error('Transport failure: ' + reply.status.status));
        } else if (isHttpReply(reply) && !isHttpSuccess(reply.header.http_status.code)) {
          request.reject({
            status: reply.header.http_status.code,
            description: reply.header.http_status.status,
            body: reply.body
          });
        } else {
          request.resolve(reply);
        }
      }, 0);
    }
  }
 
  _storeRequest(id, resolve, reject) {
    let requestDescriptor = {
      resolve: resolve,
      reject: reject,
      timeout: setTimeout(() => {
        log.debug('request', id, 'is timed out');
        reject(new Error('Twilsock: request timeout: ' + id));
      }, REQUEST_TIMEOUT)
    };
    this._activeRequests.set(id, requestDescriptor);
  }
 
  send(address, headers, body) {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      if (!this._socket.isConnected) {
        log.info('Can not send upstream message. Twilsock is not in connected state');
        reject(new Error('Twilsock is not connected'));
      }
 
      const id = this._socket.sendUpstreamMessage(address, headers, body);
      log.trace('message sent: ', { id, address, headers, body });
      this._storeRequest(id, resolve, reject);
    });
  }
 
  putNotificationContext(contextId, context) {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      if (!this._socket.isConnected) {
        log.info('Can not send put notification context. Twilsock is not in connected state');
        reject(new Error('Twilsock is not connected'));
      }
 
      let header = { method: 'put_notification_ctx', notification_ctx_id: contextId }; // eslint-disable-line camelcase
      const id = this._socket.send(header, context);
      this._storeRequest(id, resolve, reject);
    });
  }
 
  deleteNotificationContext(contextId) {
    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      if (!this._socket.isConnected) {
        log.info('Can not send delete notification context. Twilsock is not in connected state');
        reject(new Error('Twilsock is not connected'));
      }
 
      let packet = { method: 'delete_notification_ctx', notification_ctx_id: contextId }; // eslint-disable-line camelcase
      const id = this._socket.send(packet);
      this._storeRequest(id, resolve, reject);
    });
  }
 
  shutdown() {
    this._activeRequests.forEach((descriptor) => {
      clearTimeout(descriptor.timeout);
      descriptor.reject(new Error('Twilsock: request cancelled by user'));
    });
    this._activeRequests.clear();
  }
 
}
